perturbation.original_text: Client agrees to pay to Company the sum of $5,000 (the "Contract Price") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customer agrees to remit to Company the sum of $5,000 (the "Project Cost") to design and develop a website for the Customer (the "Customer Website") in accordance with the Scope of Work outlined in Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Client" and "Customer" are used interchangeably, along with "Contract Price" replaced by "Project Cost" and "Client Website" changed to "Customer Website". This could lead to confusion if the agreement refers to both a Client and a Customer as distinct entities or if there's a dispute over the agreed price or the deliverables.

perturbation.original_text: Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are subject to delay if Company does not receive the required materials or documentation in a timely manner or in the required format or if approvals are delayed by Client or if the Scope of Work is changed by Client.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customer acknowledges and agrees that any target dates defined in the Scope of Work can be extended if the Service Provider does not obtain necessary resources or data promptly, in the prescribed arrangement, or if approvals are deferred by the User, or if the Scope of Work is modified by the Customer.
perturbation.explanation: Here "Client" is switched with "Customer" and "Company" with "Service Provider". Also "due dates" are switched with "target dates", creating a perturbation that causes confusion on defining the entities and key factors.

perturbation.original_text: Company representatives are available during Company's normal business hours which are 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. UTC +2, Monday through Friday. Any email or telephone correspondence received after normal business hours will be processed the following business day. Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials.
perturbation.changed_text: The Service Provider's staff is available during the Service Provider's customary operating hours, specifically from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. UTC +2, Monday to Friday. Any email or telephone inquiries received outside standard operating hours will be attended to on the subsequent business day. The User will incur an added fee for any work needing completion beyond standard operating hours due to an expedited timeline requested by the User or resulting from the User's non-compliance with specified timelines for submission, assessment, and clearance of data, material, and content.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Company" is replaced with "Service Provider", "Client" replaced with "User", "business hours" changed to "operating hours", and "rush deadline" with "expedited timeline". This introduces confusion because it becomes unclear if the Service Provider and User are the same as Company and Client, especially regarding the obligations for rush work surcharges.
